channel.title: Gaming - Digg
channel.description: Gaming on Digg: the best articles, videos, tweets, and original content that the web is talking about right now

item.title: We Simulated A Video Game With The Worst College Basketball Team Ever, And Got An Instant Classic
item.description: Seasons No. 2 and No. 3 in SB Nation's quest to win a national title with Western Illinois in "College Hoops 2K8"

item.title: The Quiet Revolution Of Animal Crossing
item.description: In the midst of a pandemic, it's delightful to imagine doing whatever you like without worrying about making a living.

item.title: Resellers Using Checkout Bots Are Driving The Nintendo Switch Shortage
item.description: Motherboard traced some of the recent automated Switch buying to a particular, new bot that anyone can use.

item.title: Guy Notices A Fun Coincidence With The Super Mario Bros. Flagpole Fanfare Music And The Power-Up Sound Effect
item.description: Did Nintendo composer Koji Kondo hide an Easter egg inside Super Mario Bros.?

item.title: I Got My Pandemic Mantra From 'World Of Warcraft'
item.description: "You feel normal." "You feel normal." "You feel normal."

item.title: Here's Some Face-Down Card Games You Can Play With Yourself
item.description: Matt Parker demonstrates a card game you can play while you're alone.
item.kicker: THE TIMING ON THIS IS IMPECCABLE

item.title: 'Animal Crossing' Fans Are Using The Game For Tinder Dates
item.description: With social distancing forcing people apart, folks are resorting to other methods to keep their dating life intact.
item.kicker: WE AIN'T NOTHIN' BUT ANIMALS CROSSING

item.title: Pokémon Go Adds Remote Raids So You Don't Have To Go Outside
item.description: Niantic is adding a new item called a Remote Raid Pass to Pokémon Go, letting you play raids that appear on the app's map or "Nearby" page without having to go to the physical location.

item.title: A Flight Simulator Flies Some Of The World's Ugliest Planes
item.description: A YouTuber test flies some of the weirdest looking planes ever designed.

item.title: I Am Not At All Relaxed By Animal Crossing
item.description: Millions of people have found comfort in the Switch smash hit. I, however, have found myself trapped in a endless cycle of kawaii capitalism.

item.title: The Best Games For Nintendo Switch
item.description: We pick the best games for the Nintendo Switch, updated for April 2020.
item.kicker: FOR THOSE WHO HAVE NOTHING BUT TIME

item.title: A YouTuber Attempts To Get Ripped In 30 Days By Using Only Virtual Reality-Based Body Weight Workouts
item.description: Ryan Trahan found himself quarantined inside and wanted to test whether he could get ripped using only VR.

item.title: Was Leisure Suit Larry Really An Accomplice In Early Banking Cyberattacks?
item.description: In the late 80s, Sierra's hokey horndog was connected to a major computer virus, and rumor had it that the publisher may have created it to punish pirates.

item.title: Stickler Goes Through Extreme Lengths To Notify Nintendo Of A Critical Spelling Error In 'Animal Crossing'
item.description: Nick Robinson is haunted by a typo in his favorite Nintendo game and is obsessed with getting this typographical mistake fixed.

item.title: The Unbearable Lightness Of 'Animal Crossing'
item.description: "Animal Crossing" has recently gone what, in a less awful time, we might have called viral.

item.title: I Spent $8,085 To Build My Pro Sim Racing Rig. Here's What I Bought
item.description: Pro driver Robb Holland breaks down exactly what he spent to build a quarantine sim-racing rig.

item.title: The 'Jeopardy!' College Championship Is Here To Fill The Sporting Void
item.description: Desperate to watch some kind of previously unaired competition? "Jeopardy!" has you covered.

item.title: Somebody Made A Surreal 'Seinfeld' Horror Game And It Might Give You Nightmares
item.description: During quarantine, a guy and his brother made a Seinfeld horror game called "Sinfeld Chronicles" — and it's uh, a lot.

item.title: The Xbox Series X Master Plan
item.description: How Microsoft is placing its bets on a transformative decade.

item.title: Can A 1987 Commodore Amiga Beat A 2019 Macbook At Chess?
item.description: What would happen if you plugged in a 1987 Commodore Amiga 500's artificial intelligence against a Macbook computer at a game of chess?

item.title: 'Good Job!' Lets You Chaotically Smash Through Your Office Complex From Home
item.description: Nintendo's latest puzzle game for the Switch is set in a charming office environment inspired by safety signs. Players can solve puzzles with smart, slow solutions or smash their way to success with slapstick chaos.

item.title: Bronx Science Students Re-Created Their School On Minecraft
item.description: A group of Bronx High School of Science students are reconstructing a virtual campus. They aren't finished yet, but it's clear how much detail has already gone into the product.

item.title: Why Nintendo Fans Think This Porn Account Knows The Company's Secrets
item.description: Like Apple, Nintendo tries to keep what they're working on a surprise. That only makes people want to know what's going on even more.

item.title: How A Coding Error Led To A Virtual Pandemic In 'World Of Warcraft'
item.description: The infamous Corrupted Blood incident in the MMORPG helped scientists understand human behavior during a pandemic

item.title: Some Guy Found A Way To Recreate The Entire Earth On A 1:1 Scale In Minecraft
item.description: Using satellite imagery and a little ingenuity, a determined gamer is working on building a virtual land modeled exactly on the Earth.
item.kicker: HE'S GOT THE WHOLE WORLD IN HIS HANDS

item.title: How Games Marketing Invented Toxic Gamer Culture
item.description: How early marketing campaigns for online gaming platforms suggested toxicity isn't a bug, it's a feature.

item.title: The Most Successful Video Game Franchises Of All Time By Revenue, Visualized
item.description: The global video game industry makes bank, grossing an estimated $150 billion in 2019. Just like Hollywood, the video game world has some trusty franchises they can rely on for steady revenue. Here are the top video game series of all time.

item.title: YouTuber Fully Restores This Destroyed 'Space Invaders' Handheld Video Game Console From The 1980s To Its Former Glory
item.description: A restorationist unearths this dead Space Invaders Handheld Arcade Game from the 1980s and takes great pleasure in bringing it back to life.
item.kicker: ALL IT NEEDED WAS A LITTLE LOVE

item.title: Data Centers Are Plagued By Wasteful Computing. Game Theory Could Help
item.description: Data centers consume 205 billion kilowatt-hours of electricity annually. Not great.

item.title: It Took Me Eight Years To Beat This One-Minute Video Game Level
item.description: For nearly a decade, Kofie Yeboah had been haunted by a final level he could never defeat. This week, he decided it was finally time to beat it once and for all.

item.title: American Truck Simulator Is The Perfect Way To Hit The Virtual Great Outdoors
item.description: This game is exactly what it sounds like. But it's also the perfect way to get outside with actually going outside during quarantine.

item.title: ASCII Art + Permadeath: The History Of Roguelike Games
item.description: How did we get here? Well, from "Rogue," of course — but even that game wasn't created in a vacuum.

item.title: What A 'World Of Warcraft' Virtual Outbreak Taught Us About How Humans Behave In Epidemics
item.description: Revisiting a seminal 2007 paper modeling WoW's Corrupted Blood incident.

item.title: A Side-By-Side Comparison Showing The Insane Decrease In Loading Time Between The New Xbox And The Xbox One X
item.description: Microsoft demoed the capabilities of its Xbox Series X (due in late 2020) yesterday, and it is really frickin' fast.

item.title: Games To Play While You're Not Leaving The House
item.description: As Covid-19, the disease caused by the coronavirus, spreads, you're going to be spending a lot of time inside. Here are some of the best video games to help you pass the time.

item.title: Your Old Neopets May Still Be Alive, And Very Hungry
item.description: You're sitting there, minding your own business, when the thought hits you. You wait for it to pass, but it forces its way to the front of your mind. There's no escaping the truth: you abandoned your Neopets, you monster.
item.kicker: TO THE SOUP KITCHEN WE GO

item.title: Roberta Williams Is The World's First Graphic Computer Game Designer — But She's Famous For All The Wrong Reasons
item.description: "Video game history doesn't know how to make sense of her except to single her out."

item.title: The Rise Of Impossibly Cute And Wholesome Games
item.description: From frog detectives to adventuring fruit, games are getting real cute.

item.title: These Mini Mario Kart Stunts Are Weirdly Compelling To Watch
item.description: The tiniest thrill of your life!

item.title: Playing This Deeply Soothing Zamboni Simulator Might Help You Forget How Terrible Everything Is
item.description: The current state of the world is, to put it mildly, not great. And while the internet is a source of bad news, it can also provide a small oasis of calm.

item.title: 'The Longing,' Which Can Take Over A Year To Finish, Encourages You To Embrace Waiting
item.description: At the beginning of the PC game "The Longing," your character, a skinny gollum called a Shade, is ordered to wake their giant stone king in 400 days. That's 400 real-time days.

item.title: One Of The Rarest Video Game Consoles Of All Time Just Sold For $360,000 At Auction
item.description: A failed partnership 28 years ago between a pair of gigantic names in gaming has resulted in one of the rarest pieces of hardware in video game history selling at auction today for a staggering $360,000—and it doesn't even include a single game.
item.kicker: AND YOU CAN'T EVEN PLAY IT

item.title: How Nickelodeon Put Kids Inside Video Games On 'Nick Arcade'
item.description: How the wildly popular early 90s Nickelodeon show "Nick Arcade" pulled off its incredible technical design.

item.title: Gamer Completes 'The Legend Of Zelda: Breath Of The Wild' Entirely Without Walking
item.description:
A man proved you can finish "Breath of the Wild" entirely by
paragliding, climbing, swimming, shield surfing and flurry rushing.

item.title: Gamer Runs His Old PS1 Games In 4K On His PC, With Beautiful Results
item.description: The graphics of the games we played in the '90s look worse in retrospect, but also, as one commenter put it, "Man I swear the 4K versions are what the games looked like when I was younger."

item.title: How Riot Games Finally Made Something New
item.description: Riot Games, the studio behind juggernaut "MOBA League of Legends," is ready to reveal its second all-new universe: "Valorant."

item.title: How 'Crash Bandicoot' Hacked Into The Hardware Of The Sony Playstation To Squeeze Out As Much Memory As Possible
item.description: Andy Gavin explains how he was able to hack the Sony Playstation's built-in code libraries to their bone to maximize the available memory.

item.title: E-Sports Are Rife With Exploitation
item.description: The corporate success of competitive gaming obscures the industry's dark side: a massive underclass of underpaid freelancers.

item.title: How To Win Monopoly In The Shortest Possible Time
item.description: One of the best-selling board games of all time makes several cardinal sins of good design, which means it has attracted a great deal of ire over the years.

item.title: 20 Years Of 'The Sims' Keeping Up With Our Bizarre Reality
item.description: "The Sims" is a reflection of human life: it shows us how we love, create families and interact with the world around us.
